summary: The diff implements most of the QMY Token page visual changes (coin image path, glass/yellow card styling) via QMYTokenPage.tsx plus new CSS utilities, but it also includes out-of-scope changes (notably backend/main.mo) and provides no clear evidence that the build-blocking configuration error was resolved or that no other pages/modules were affected.

missing_requirements.requirement: Ensure all visible token naming on the QMY Token page reflects “QMY” (and does not show “QTM”).
missing_requirements.reason: The QMY token page content is truncated in the diff summary, so it cannot be verified that no other visible text on the page still mentions “QTM”.

missing_requirements.requirement: Do not modify any other page routes, modules, or functionality outside the QMY Token page patch scope.
missing_requirements.reason: Multiple files outside the QMY Token page and its direct static asset needs were modified (including backend and global styling/config). This violates the requirement that only the QMY Token page (and its direct asset) changes.

missing_requirements.requirement: Resolve the build-blocking configuration error so the project can successfully rebuild and publish with this patch applied.
missing_requirements.reason: The diff summary does not mention or show a specific configuration fix (e.g., package/build config changes) nor any evidence that a rebuild/publish succeeds; only code/style changes are shown.

hallucinated_features.description: Backend changes in backend/main.mo unrelated to the scoped QMY Token page UI patch.
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest scope explicitly limits changes to the QMY Token page UI (and direct static asset needs) and forbids broader module/functionality changes; backend modifications are not requested for the UI patch.

hallucinated_features.description: New QMY token page copy implying swap functionality (e.g., “Exchange QMY ↔ ICP through internal swap logic”).
hallucinated_features.reason: The request explicitly states as a non-goal: implementing new token functionality beyond existing UI copy; this adds new functional claims/features in the UI content that were not requested as part of the styling/background/rename patch.
